intro: Tinus nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan tinus, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas for its vibrant blooms.
